## Data Manipulation & Summarization

+---------------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
| Function                  | Package   | Purpose / Use                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | Lesson / Additional Resources     |

| `select(var)`             | tidyverse | selects specified variables from dataframe                                                                                                                                                                                                              | Week 2: select()                  |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | in argument, can use:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |                                   |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | -   single variable                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |                                   |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | -   multiple vars, separated by comma                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |                                   |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | -   contains("")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |                                   |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | -   starts_with("")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |                                   |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | -   ends_with("")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |                                   |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | -   var:var (selects range of vars)                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |                                   |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | -   -var (drops var)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |                                   |
+---------------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
| `filter()`                | tidyverse | selects subset of observations, using comparison operators (==, !=, \>, \>=, \<, \<=, is.na, !is.na, %in%) and logical operators (&, \|, !)                                                                                                             | Week 2: filter()                  |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | -   `filter(var == 10)`                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                                   |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | -   `filter(is.na(var))`                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                   |
+---------------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
| `drop_na()`               | tidyverse | in addition to `filter(!is.na())`, `drop_na()` can be used to remove observations with NA values                                                                                                                                                        | Week 2: filter()                  |
+---------------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
| `mutate()`                | tidyverse | makes or changes existing vars:                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | Week 2: mutate()                  |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | -   to make var w/ specific value: `mutate(var = "")`                                                                                                                                                                                                   | Week 7: Changing Variable Types   |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | -   to make a new var based on other vars: `mutate(var1 = var * 2)`                                                                                                                                                                                     | Week 7: Tidy Data Rule #3         |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | -   to change an existing var: `mutate(var = var + 1)`                                                                                                                                                                                                  | Week 7: Dealing with Missing Data |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           |     -   to change var type: `mutate(var = as.numeric(var))` `mutate(var = as.character(var))`                                                                                                                                                           | Week 3: session                   |
|                           |           |     -   to remove a string of text: `mutate(var = str_remove(var,pattern = "text to remove"))`                                                                                                                                                          |                                   |
|                           |           |     -   to recode specified values: `mutate(var = recode(var,"old value" = "new value"))`                                                                                                                                                               |                                   |
|                           |           |     -   to modify value based on a condition: `mutate(var = if_else(var == "some_value",true = "if_true_value",false = "else_value"))`                                                                                                                  |                                   |
|                           |           |     -   to modify value based on multiple conditions: `mutate(var = case_when(var == "some value" ~ "new value",var == "some B value" ~ "new B value",var == "some C value" ~ "new C value",.default = "value for all others that don't match above"))` |                                   |
|                           |           |     -   to remove non-numeric characters and convert var to numeric: `mutate(var = parse_number(var))`                                                                                                                                                  |                                   |
|                           |           |     -   to set value as NA based on condition: `mutate(var = na_if(var, "condition"))`                                                                                                                                                                  |                                   |
|                           |           |     -   to change cell value from NA to specified value: `mutate(var = replace_na(var, "value to replace"))`                                                                                                                                            |                                   |
|                           |           |     -   to wrap text (to be used with plot labels): `mutate(var_wrapped = str_wrap(var, width = Xwidth))`                                                                                                                                               |                                   |
|                           |           |     -   to reorder a var for a plot: `mutate(var = fct_relevel(var, "cell value1", "cell value2", "cell value3"))` or `mutate(plottedvar = fct_relevel(plottedvar, var_to_order_by))`                                                                   |                                   |
+---------------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
| `group_by()`              | tidyverse | groups data by a specified variable, often used with `summarize()`                                                                                                                                                                                      | Week 2: group_by()                |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | `group_by(varX) |>summarize(mean_varY = mean(varY, na.rm = TRUE))`                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                   |
+---------------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
| `summarize()`             | tidyverse | summarizes a variable based on specified argument, for example: `summarize(mean_var = mean(var))`                                                                                                                                                       | Week 2: summarize()               |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | must remove NA values using `drop_na(var)` or in argument: `summarize(mean_var = mean(var, na.rm = TRUE))`                                                                                                                                              |                                   |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | can have multiple summaries in one function: `summarize(mean_var = mean(var, na.rm = TRUE),max_var = max(var, na.rm = TRUE))`                                                                                                                           |                                   |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | can be used with `group_by()` or can add argument within summarize: `summarize(mean_var = mean(var, na.rm = TRUE),.by = c(var1, var2))`                                                                                                                 |                                   |
+---------------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
| `count()`                 | tidyverse | counts observations based on specified variable                                                                                                                                                                                                         | Week 2: group_by()                |
+---------------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
| `tably(var, var)`         | janitor   | produces crosstab                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | Week 2: session                   |
+---------------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
| `arrange()`               | tidyverse | sorts dataset based on specified variables, in ascending order by default                                                                                                                                                                               | Week 2: arrange()                 |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | to sort in descending order, use `arrnge(desc(var))`                                                                                                                                                                                                    |                                   |
+---------------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
| `pivot_longer()`          | tidyverse | reshapes long                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | Week 7: Tidy Data Rule #1         |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | `pivot_longer(cols = cols_to_use,names_to = "name_of_identifier_var",values_to = "name_of_value_var")`                                                                                                                                                  |                                   |
+---------------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
| `separate_longer_delim()` |           | reshapes data based on multiselect variable, such that one row = one response option                                                                                                                                                                    |                                   |
|                           |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |
|                           |           | `separate_longer_delim(variable,delim = ", ")`                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                                   |
+---------------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
| `slice_max()`             |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | Week 9: lesson                    |
+---------------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
| `pull()`                  |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | Week 9: lesson                    |
+---------------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
| `str_glue("{var} text")`  |           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                   |

# Tips

-   project workflow
    -   in github, each repo is a project?
-   general
    -   when selecting a file, enter folder name and hit TAB, which will pull up a list of files you can select from
    -   to view the help file for a function, type in the console: ?functionname
-   to create global variables (like for file paths), edit your .Renviron file - see Week 6 session \~38:00
-   tidy data -- more [here](https://openscapes.org/blog/2020-10-12-tidy-data/)
    -   every column is a variable
    -   every row is an observation
    -   every cell is a single value
-   keyboard shortcuts
    -   CMD + shift + M = pipe operator
    -   CMD + shift + C = insert comment#
    -   CTRL + L = clears console
-   [cheatsheets](https://github.com/rfortherestofus/rin3-fall-2023/blob/main/misc/beginner-cheatsheets.pdf)
-   quarto
    -   resources
        -   [markdown basics](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/markdown-basics.html)
        -   [code block cell options](https://quarto.org/docs/reference/cells/cells-knitr.html)
        -   [custom CSS for HTML](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/html-basics.html#css-styles)
        -   [creating a website using quarto](https://quarto-workshop.netlify.app/)
    -   tips
        -   to run an R script at the top of quarto doc (and use cleaned data and plots), include a code chunk with `source("filename.R")`
        -   creating custom look and feel --- depends on output type
            -   for using HTML divs to create columns and manage page layout, see 49:00 of [Lesson 4: session](https://rfortherestofus.com/courses/r-in-3-months-fall-2023/lessons/live-session)
-   [shiny documentation](https://shiny.posit.co/r/gallery/#feature-demos)
